content.p: What is the probability that at least one of the next two strangers you meet shares your birth month? For this problem assume birth months are equally likely, so the probability of being born in a given month is 1/12 (about 0.083).

p.em: Let A = first stranger shares your birth month
Let B = second stranger shares your birth month

content.p: Assume that meeting two strangers is like randomly selecting two people from a large population.

response.feedback: Correct. The events are independent because the two strangers are randomly selected from a large population. So the probability that the first stranger shares your birth month does not affect the probability that the second stranger shares your birth month.
